alert.note: Alert for Alger; Luce; Northern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 4:26AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...SNOW AND PATCHY BLOWING SNOW FRIDAY AFTERNOON...FOLLOWED BY LAKE EFFECT SNOW...HIGH WINDS AND CONSIDERABLE BLOWING SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT... A fast moving clipper system is expected to bring 1 to 4 inches of snow and southerly wind gusts up to 35 mph Friday afternoon. The greatest snow accumulations will occur from Grand Marais to Seney eastward to Newberry. The combination of falling and blowing snow is expected to result in low visibilities and snow covered roads Friday afternoon. Up to two inches of additional lake effect snow and strong northwesterly winds gusting 40 to 50 mph are expected Friday night, beginning during the late evening. Winds will gust as high as 55 mph in open areas near Lake Superior. The combination of falling and blowing snow is expected to result in near blizzard conditions at times late Friday night. Travelers should plan on extra time to reach their destination or consider adjusting their travel plans.
